originalText: fo_messer
Start Element
messer

::You see a stout middle-aged man butchering a pig. You observe the motions he makes with each cut and notice how every single one is performed with great ease and accuracy, reflecting years and years of experience. After a few moments, the man puts his knife aside and wipes his hands clean. After that, he turns to you with a slight smile, then begins speaking in a baritone voice of unusual warmth with just a hint of huskiness in it.::

Why, hello there. I haven't seen you around here before. I'm Kirk Messer, the local butcher, as you can probably see. ::He laughs.:: What do you need?
context.npc_fo_messer_met
context.npc_fo_messer_met
Long time no see, friend. Could you just make it quick? I *just* got a fresh shipment of hopper meat from Camp Hathor.
Hey, glad to see you again. Tell me, what can I do for you?
Let me see what you have to offer. ::Barter.::
What can you tell me about Foundry?
What's the quality of the meat you offer here?
How do you feel now that the mine is reopened?
Do those bums from the slums cause you any problems?
Do you remember anyone coming to you with any strange items? I cannot describe the item, but it's something you would definitely remember.
How do you feel about those mine creatures that have been troubling Foundry lately?
See you later.

Hmmm, I'm guessing I don't need to say anything about the pollution, 'cause you can experience that for yourself. Yeah. A piece of advice: Be careful what you eat, drink and remember to wear your respirator so the foul air doesn't slowly kill you. It's like smoking - your throat is the first thing to go after a while, and then, depending on your luck, your health slowly leaves down the same tunnel.

Let's put it this way... ::He cuts a piece of meat on the cutting table and shows it to you.:: Just look at the color of this one. Smell it. I don't sell muck, this is fresh and quality meat! If you're worried about Foundry's pollution problems affecting the meat quality, don't be. ::Messer eats the raw piece of meat he just showed you.::
Very glad, how else would I feel? The mine is back in business and those filthy, filthy creatures will bother us no more! Yeah. And they taste awful!
Yeah... I'd not talk about it. ::He continues cutting the meat on the table.::

Strange items? Hmmm... No, not as far as I can remember. People come here to buy meat; no one brings anything strange in here. Now, doing strange things is a completely different story! A couple days ago a man came in here - Sonny, one of the miners - claiming that he'd been seeing strange shadows moving across the Foundry ceiling. Yeah. Like ghosts or something. I told him to get himself and his derailed ideas out of here. ::He laughs.::

Well, I don't like 'em, I think that should be obvious. Yeah. They've killed miners and Foundry guardsmen and are responsible for the - temporary - closing of the mine... But, if we put all that aside for a moment, I often wonder what they taste like. You know, uh, if their meat is edible... and tastes at least somewhat good... I could become the only one who can offer that unique meat - in whole South Underrail! Get your rocky steaks at Messer's. Yeah.
I sincerely hope so. See you around.
Yet, so many people live here despite all that.
I'll keep that in mind. Let me ask you something else.
Mhm, good stuff! See? I'm eating it raw - that's how confident I am in its quality. So, yeah, I think that should be enough proof. Purchase your meat here and you're golden!
I could even taste the mineral saturation. Disgusting! Even dogs won't eat that.
Let's talk about something else.
That doesn't help me much.

::Messer drifts off for a moment, obviously thinking about his hypothetical future. He becomes aware of what he is doing, though, and looks at you again.::

Anyway, what can I do for you?

Well, you lose on one front but win on several others: The iron mine brings in a lot of money to Foundry, and people like money. ::He laughs.:: Yeah. Also, the Foundry Guard keeps us safe from the Ironheads, and we've never had any of the raider jackasses penetrate the outer perimeter. Since I moved here, I literally forgot what it's like to live in fear of raiders.
Yeah?
::He shrugs.:: That's all I've got for you, $(#man/honey).
And despite the fact that the crime rate has gone up in the last few months, I still feel perfectly safe.
